# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col)      # Lowercase the string
    col = strip(col)              # Remove leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, r"\s+|-"=>"_")  # Replace spaces/hyphens with underscore
    return col
end
```

The `clean_column` function follows the given steps to clean a column name. It uses Julia's built-in functions like `lowercase`, `strip`, and `replace`. The regular expression in the `replace` function matches one or more whitespace characters (`\s+`) or hyphens (`-`) and replaces them with an underscore (`_`).
